title: Valencian language
summary: Valencian[lower-alpha 1] (valenci√†)[lower-alpha 2] or Valencian language[4] (llengua valenciana)[lower-alpha 3] is the official, historical and traditional name used in the Valencian Community (Spain), and extra-officially in the El Carche comarca in Murcia (Spain),[5][6][7][8] to refer to the Romance language also known as Catalan.[lower-alpha 4][lower-alpha 5][9][10][11][12][13] The Valencian Community's 1982 Statute of Autonomy and the Spanish Constitution officially recognise Valencian as the regional language.[4]
